page.title: 19SOCIAL CONCERNS RAFFORD AREA
page.content: The main concern in the village of Rafford is the safety of children.Many of the houses are near the main road and as there is no speed limit, lorries and car speed along the road. Many people would like to see at least a 40mph speed limit on the road.Another wish is for a path through the village so that older people would not have to use the main road. There is need in the area for a local general store and this would save people having to go to Forres for essential supplies. In our local paper we read that the people in the Rafford area have protested to the local council about its refusal to allow Finefare to build a supermarket in Forres.
